Package Battleship.model

Class BattleshipModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • Battleship.model.BattleshipModel
  • public class BattleshipModel
extends java.lang.Object
    The class BattleshipModel is the main class of the application as it contains the game data. For each game it creates a HashMap that contains the a Player as the key and a GameBoard as the value. It lets players make a move, keeps track of the active player and checks whether or not the game is over. After a game has been won, it updates logFile.txt and highscores.txt. It contains the inner Enum "Ship" which defines the possible ships in the game.
    Version:
    1.0 02.02.2020
    Author:
    Elien Vissers-Similon

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame​(java.lang.Boolean isComputer,
                      java.lang.String name1,
                      java.lang.String name2)
        Starts a new game: creates the ships, players and gameboards based on the predefined gridsize and number of ships.
        Parameters:
        isComputer - determines whether the new game is player-versus-player or player-versus-computer
        name1 - the name of player 1
        name2 - the name of player 2

      • prepareBoard

        public void prepareBoard()
        Gets the ship coordinates from the activeplayer and adds them to his/her gameboard in the HashMap.

      • activePlayerPlays

        public int[] activePlayerPlays​(int x,
                               int y)
        Lets the active player make a move: 1. Has a ship been hit? The method checks if the target coordinates are present in the the passive players's gameboard. 2. Has a ship been sunken? The method checks if the target was the last the last coordinate of the ship to be hit. After the move the turn counter is increased and the active and passive player switch roles.
        Parameters:
        x - the target x-coordinate
        y - the target y-coordinate
        Returns:
        an array that holds the results of the players move: if a ship was hit, if the targeted ship sunk, and important data of said ship

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks whether the game is over or not.
        Returns:
        isGameOver boolean value

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
        Saves the game by updating logFile.txt and highscores.txt 1. logFile.txt: contains the gridsize, number of ships, date, name of the winning player and amount of turns for each game 2. highscores.txt: contains the number of wins for each winner in logFile.txt
